page.title: 07Cotswold Shepherd's Bothy
page.content: Along the ancient track at Kineton Hill are several old buildings, one of which is to be preserved as it is a complete shepherd's bothy. It was a little house where the shepherds rested their flocks on the way to and from Stow on the Wold sheep fairs. It is in the back wall of a complete stone-walled yard where the sheep were penned. It has a round pot chimney inside and very old plaster containing cow hair on the walls, and in the torching in the roof. There is also a cottage building at Kineton Hill farm which is notable for having dry stone walls without lime dust mortar to hold the stones together. This is probably over 300 years old.
